an3.1:1.2.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
an3.1:1.2.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.

an3.1:1.3.eng: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,

an3.1:2.1.pli: “Yāni kānici, bhikkhave, bhayāni uppajjanti sabbāni tāni bālato uppajjanti, no paṇḍitato.
an3.1:2.1.eng: “Whatever dangers there are, all come from the foolish, not from the astute.

an3.1:2.2.pli: Ye keci upaddavā uppajjanti sabbe te bālato uppajjanti, no paṇḍitato.
an3.1:2.2.eng: Whatever perils there are, all come from the foolish, not from the astute.

an3.1:2.3.pli: Ye keci upasaggā uppajjanti sabbe te bālato uppajjanti, no paṇḍitato.
an3.1:2.3.eng: Whatever hazards there are, all come from the foolish, not from the astute.

an3.1:2.4.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, naḷāgārā vā tiṇāgārā vā aggi mutto kūṭāgārānipi ḍahati ullittāvalittāni nivātāni phusitaggaḷāni pihitavātapānāni;
an3.1:2.4.eng: It’s like a fire that spreads from a hut made of reeds or grass, and burns down even a bungalow, plastered inside and out, draft-free, with doors fastened and windows shuttered.

an3.1:2.5.pli: evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, yāni kānici bhayāni uppajjanti sabbāni tāni bālato uppajjanti, no paṇḍitato.
an3.1:2.5.eng: In the same way, whatever dangers there are, all come from the foolish, not from the astute.

an3.1:2.6.pli: Ye keci upaddavā uppajjanti sabbe te bālato uppajjanti, no paṇḍitato.
an3.1:2.6.eng: Whatever perils there are, all come from the foolish, not from the astute.

an3.1:2.7.pli: Ye keci upasaggā uppajjanti sabbe te bālato uppajjanti, no paṇḍitato.
an3.1:2.7.eng: Whatever hazards there are, all come from the foolish, not from the astute.

an3.1:3.1.pli: Iti kho, bhikkhave, sappaṭibhayo bālo, appaṭibhayo paṇḍito.
an3.1:3.1.eng: So, the fool is dangerous, but the astute person is safe.

an3.1:3.2.eng: The fool is perilous, but the astute person is not.

an3.1:3.3.eng: The fool is hazardous, but the astute person is not.

an3.1:3.4.pli: Natthi, bhikkhave, paṇḍitato bhayaṃ, natthi paṇḍitato upaddavo, natthi paṇḍitato upasaggo.
an3.1:3.4.eng: There’s no danger, peril, or hazard that comes from the astute.

an3.1:4.1.eng: So you should train like this:

an3.1:4.2.pli: ‘yehi tīhi dhammehi samannāgato bālo veditabbo te tayo dhamme abhinivajjetvā, yehi tīhi dhammehi samannāgato paṇḍito veditabbo te tayo dhamme samādāya vattissāmā’ti.
an3.1:4.2.eng: ‘We will shun the three things by which a fool is known, and we will undertake and follow the three things by which an astute person is known.’

an3.10:1.1.pli: “Tīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato tayo male appahāya yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an3.10:1.1.eng: “Anyone who has three qualities, and has not given up three stains, is cast down to hell.

an3.10:1.3.pli: Dussīlo ca hoti, dussīlyamalañcassa appahīnaṃ hoti;
an3.10:1.3.eng: They’re unethical, and haven’t given up the stain of immorality.

an3.10:1.4.pli: issukī ca hoti, issāmalañcassa appahīnaṃ hoti;
an3.10:1.4.eng: They’re jealous, and haven’t given up the stain of jealousy.

an3.10:1.5.pli: maccharī ca hoti, maccheramalañcassa appahīnaṃ hoti.
an3.10:1.5.eng: They’re stingy, and haven’t given up the stain of stinginess.

an3.10:1.6.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato ime tayo male appahāya yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an3.10:1.6.eng: Anyone who possesses these three qualities, and has not given up these three stains, is cast down to hell.

an3.10:2.1.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato tayo male pahāya yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge.
an3.10:2.1.eng: Anyone who has three qualities, and has given up three stains, is raised up to heaven.

an3.10:2.3.pli: Sīlavā ca hoti, dussīlyamalañcassa pahīnaṃ hoti;
an3.10:2.3.eng: They’re ethical, and have given up the stain of immorality.

an3.10:2.4.pli: anissukī ca hoti, issāmalañcassa pahīnaṃ hoti;
an3.10:2.4.eng: They’re not jealous, and have given up the stain of jealousy.

an3.10:2.5.pli: amaccharī ca hoti, maccheramalañcassa pahīnaṃ hoti.
an3.10:2.5.eng: They’re not stingy, and have given up the stain of stinginess.

an3.10:2.6.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato ime tayo male pahāya yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge”ti.
an3.10:2.6.eng: Anyone who possesses these three qualities, and has given up these three stains, is raised up to heaven.”

an3.100:1.2.pli: ‘yathā yathāyaṃ puriso kammaṃ karoti tathā tathā taṃ paṭisaṃvediyatī’ti, evaṃ santaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyavāso na hoti, okāso na paññāyati sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāya.
an3.100:1.2.eng: ‘No matter how this person performs a deed, they experience it the same way.’ This being so, the spiritual life could not be lived, and there’d be no chance of making a complete end of suffering.

an3.100:1.3.pli: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, evaṃ vadeyya:

an3.100:1.4.pli: ‘yathā yathā vedanīyaṃ ayaṃ puriso kammaṃ karoti tathā tathāssa vipākaṃ paṭisaṃvediyatī’ti, evaṃ santaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyavāso hoti, okāso paññāyati sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāya.
an3.100:1.4.eng: ‘No matter how this person performs a deed, they experience the result as it should be experienced.’ This being so, the spiritual life can be lived, and there is a chance of making a complete end of suffering.

an3.100:1.5.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa appamattakampi pāpakammaṃ kataṃ tamenaṃ nirayaṃ upaneti.
an3.100:1.5.eng: Take the case of the individual who does a trivial bad deed, but it lands them in hell.

an3.100:1.6.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa tādisaṃyeva appamattakaṃ pāpakammaṃ kataṃ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṃ hoti, nāṇupi khāyati, kiṃ bahudeva.
an3.100:1.6.eng: Meanwhile, another individual does the same trivial bad deed, but experiences it in this life, so that not even a little remains, let alone a lot.

an3.100:2.1.pli: Kathaṃrūpassa, bhikkhave, puggalassa appamattakampi pāpakammaṃ kataṃ tamenaṃ nirayaṃ upaneti?
an3.100:2.1.eng: What kind of individual does a trivial bad deed, but it lands them in hell?

an3.100:2.2.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo abhāvitakāyo hoti abhāvitasīlo abhāvitacitto abhāvitapañño paritto appātumo appadukkhavihārī.
an3.100:2.2.eng: An individual who hasn’t developed their physical endurance, ethics, mind, or wisdom. They’re small-minded and mean-spirited, living in suffering.

an3.100:2.3.pli: Evarūpassa, bhikkhave, puggalassa appamattakampi pāpakammaṃ kataṃ tamenaṃ nirayaṃ upaneti.
an3.100:2.3.eng: That kind of individual does a trivial bad deed, but it lands them in hell.

an3.100:3.1.pli: Kathaṃrūpassa, bhikkhave, puggalassa tādisaṃyeva appamattakaṃ pāpakammaṃ kataṃ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṃ hoti, nāṇupi khāyati, kiṃ bahudeva?
an3.100:3.1.eng: What kind of individual does the same trivial bad deed, but experiences it in this life, so that not even a little remains, let alone a lot?

an3.100:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo bhāvitakāyo hoti bhāvitasīlo bhāvitacitto bhāvitapañño aparitto mahatto appamāṇavihārī.
an3.100:3.2.eng: An individual who has developed their physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom. They’re not small-minded, but are big-hearted, meditating on the immeasurables.

an3.100:3.3.pli: Evarūpassa, bhikkhave, puggalassa tādisaṃyeva appamattakaṃ pāpakammaṃ kataṃ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṃ hoti, nāṇupi khāyati, kiṃ bahudeva.
an3.100:3.3.eng: That kind of individual does the same trivial bad deed, but experiences it in this life, so that not even a little remains, let alone a lot.

an3.100:4.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, puriso loṇakapallaṃ paritte udakamallake pakkhipeyya.
an3.100:4.1.eng: Suppose a person was to drop a lump of salt into a mug of water.

an3.100:4.3.pli: api nu taṃ parittaṃ udakaṃ amunā loṇakapallena loṇaṃ assa apeyyan”ti?
an3.100:4.3.eng: Would that mug of water become salty and undrinkable?”

an3.100:4.6.pli: “Aduñhi, bhante, parittaṃ udakakapallake udakaṃ, taṃ amunā loṇakapallena loṇaṃ assa apeyyan”ti.
an3.100:4.6.eng: Because there is only a little water in the bowl.”

an3.100:4.7.pli: “Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, puriso loṇakapallakaṃ gaṅgāya nadiyā pakkhipeyya.
an3.100:4.7.eng: “Suppose a person was to drop a lump of salt into the Ganges river.

an3.100:4.9.pli: api nu sā gaṅgā nadī amunā loṇakapallena loṇaṃ assa apeyyā”ti?
an3.100:4.9.eng: Would the Ganges river become salty and undrinkable?”

an3.100:4.12.pli: “Asu hi, bhante, gaṅgāya nadiyā mahā udakakkhandho so amunā loṇakapallena loṇo na assa apeyyo”ti.
an3.100:4.12.eng: Because the Ganges river is a vast mass of water.”

an3.100:5.1.pli: “Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, idhekaccassa puggalassa appamattakampi pāpakammaṃ kataṃ tamenaṃ nirayaṃ upaneti.
an3.100:5.1.eng: “This is how it is in the case of an individual who does a trivial bad deed, but it lands them in hell.

an3.100:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa tādisaṃyeva appamattakaṃ pāpakammaṃ kataṃ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṃ hoti, nāṇupi khāyati, kiṃ bahudeva.
an3.100:5.2.eng: Meanwhile, another individual does the same trivial bad deed, but experiences it in this life, so that not even a little remains, let alone a lot. …

an3.100:6.1.pli: Kathaṃrūpassa, bhikkhave, puggalassa appamattakampi pāpakammaṃ kataṃ tamenaṃ nirayaṃ upaneti?

an3.100:6.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo abhāvitakāyo hoti abhāvitasīlo abhāvitacitto abhāvitapañño paritto appātumo appadukkhavihārī.

an3.100:6.3.pli: Evarūpassa, bhikkhave, puggalassa appamattakampi pāpakammaṃ kataṃ tamenaṃ nirayaṃ upaneti.

an3.100:7.1.pli: Kathaṃrūpassa, bhikkhave, puggalassa tādisaṃyeva appamattakaṃ pāpakammaṃ kataṃ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṃ hoti, nāṇupi khāyati, kiṃ bahudeva?

an3.100:7.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo bhāvitakāyo hoti bhāvitasīlo bhāvitacitto bhāvitapañño aparitto mahatto appamāṇavihārī.

an3.100:7.3.pli: Evarūpassa, bhikkhave, puggalassa tādisaṃyeva appamattakaṃ pāpakammaṃ kataṃ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṃ hoti, nāṇupi khāyati, kiṃ bahudeva.

an3.100:8.1.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco aḍḍhakahāpaṇenapi bandhanaṃ nigacchati, kahāpaṇenapi bandhanaṃ nigacchati, kahāpaṇasatenapi bandhanaṃ nigacchati.
an3.100:8.1.eng: Take the case of someone who is thrown in jail for stealing half a dollar, a dollar, or a hundred dollars.

an3.100:8.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco aḍḍhakahāpaṇenapi na bandhanaṃ nigacchati, kahāpaṇenapi na bandhanaṃ nigacchati, kahāpaṇasatenapi na bandhanaṃ nigacchati.
an3.100:8.2.eng: While someone else isn’t thrown in jail for stealing half a dollar, a dollar, or a hundred dollars.

an3.100:9.1.pli: Kathaṃrūpo, bhikkhave, aḍḍhakahāpaṇenapi bandhanaṃ nigacchati, kahāpaṇenapi bandhanaṃ nigacchati, kahāpaṇasatenapi bandhanaṃ nigacchati?
an3.100:9.1.eng: What sort of person is thrown in jail for stealing half a dollar, a dollar, or a hundred dollars?

an3.100:9.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco daliddo hoti appassako appabhogo.
an3.100:9.2.eng: Someone who is poor, with few possessions and little wealth.

an3.100:9.3.pli: Evarūpo, bhikkhave, aḍḍhakahāpaṇenapi bandhanaṃ nigacchati, kahāpaṇenapi bandhanaṃ nigacchati, kahāpaṇasatenapi bandhanaṃ nigacchati.
an3.100:9.3.eng: That kind of person is thrown in jail for stealing half a dollar, a dollar, or a hundred dollars.

an3.100:10.1.pli: Kathaṃrūpo, bhikkhave, aḍḍhakahāpaṇenapi na bandhanaṃ nigacchati, kahāpaṇenapi na bandhanaṃ nigacchati, kahāpaṇasatenapi na bandhanaṃ nigacchati?
an3.100:10.1.eng: What sort of person isn’t thrown in jail for stealing half a dollar, a dollar, or a hundred dollars?

an3.100:10.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco aḍḍho hoti mahaddhano mahābhogo.
an3.100:10.2.eng: Someone who is rich, affluent, and wealthy.

an3.100:10.3.pli: Evarūpo, bhikkhave, aḍḍhakahāpaṇenapi na bandhanaṃ nigacchati, kahāpaṇenapi na bandhanaṃ nigacchati, kahāpaṇasatenapi na bandhanaṃ nigacchati.
an3.100:10.3.eng: That kind of person isn’t thrown in jail for stealing half a dollar, a dollar, or a hundred dollars.

an3.100:10.4.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, idhekaccassa puggalassa appamattakaṃ pāpakammaṃ kataṃ.
an3.100:10.4.eng: This is how it is in the case of an individual who does a trivial bad deed, but they go to hell.

an3.100:10.6.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa tādisaṃyeva appamattakaṃ pāpakammaṃ kataṃ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṃ hoti, nāṇupi khāyati, kiṃ bahudeva.
an3.100:10.6.eng: Meanwhile, another individual does the same trivial bad deed, but experiences it in this life, so that not even a little remains, let alone a lot. …

an3.100:11.1.pli: Kathaṃrūpassa, bhikkhave, puggalassa appamattakaṃ pāpakammaṃ kataṃ, tamenaṃ nirayaṃ upaneti?

an3.100:11.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo abhāvitakāyo hoti abhāvitasīlo abhāvitacitto abhāvitapañño paritto appātumo appadukkhavihārī.

an3.100:11.3.pli: Evarūpassa, bhikkhave, puggalassa tādisaṃyeva appamattakaṃ pāpakammaṃ kataṃ tamenaṃ nirayaṃ upaneti.

an3.100:12.1.pli: Kathaṃrūpassa, bhikkhave, puggalassa tādisaṃyeva appamattakaṃ pāpakammaṃ kataṃ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṃ hoti, nāṇupi khāyati, kiṃ bahudeva?

an3.100:12.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo bhāvitakāyo hoti bhāvitasīlo bhāvitacitto bhāvitapañño aparitto mahatto appamāṇavihārī.

an3.100:12.3.pli: Evarūpassa, bhikkhave, puggalassa tādisaṃyeva appamattakaṃ pāpakammaṃ kataṃ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṃ hoti, nāṇupi khāyati, kiṃ bahudeva.

an3.100:13.1.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo bhāvitakāyo hoti bhāvitasīlo bhāvitacitto bhāvitapañño aparitto mahatto appamāṇavihārī.

an3.100:13.2.pli: Evarūpassa, bhikkhave, puggalassa tādisaṃyeva appamattakaṃ pāpakammaṃ kataṃ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṃ hoti, nāṇupi khāyati, kiṃ bahudeva.

an3.100:13.3.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, orabbhiko vā urabbhaghātako vā appekaccaṃ urabbhaṃ adinnaṃ ādiyamānaṃ pahoti hantuṃ vā bandhituṃ vā jāpetuṃ vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā kātuṃ, appekaccaṃ urabbhaṃ adinnaṃ ādiyamānaṃ nappahoti hantuṃ vā bandhituṃ vā jāpetuṃ vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā kātuṃ.
an3.100:13.3.eng: It’s like a sheep dealer or butcher. They can execute, jail, fine, or otherwise punish one person who steals from them, but not another.

an3.100:14.1.pli: Kathaṃrūpaṃ, bhikkhave, orabbhiko vā urabbhaghātako vā urabbhaṃ adinnaṃ ādiyamānaṃ pahoti hantuṃ vā bandhituṃ vā jāpetuṃ vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā kātuṃ?
an3.100:14.1.eng: What sort of person can they punish?

an3.100:14.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco daliddo hoti appassako appabhogo.
an3.100:14.2.eng: Someone who is poor, with few possessions and little wealth.

an3.100:14.3.pli: Evarūpaṃ, bhikkhave, orabbhiko vā urabbhaghātako vā urabbhaṃ adinnaṃ ādiyamānaṃ pahoti hantuṃ vā bandhituṃ vā jāpetuṃ vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā kātuṃ.
an3.100:14.3.eng: That’s the kind of person they can punish.

an3.100:15.1.pli: Kathaṃrūpaṃ, bhikkhave, orabbhiko vā urabbhaghātako vā urabbhaṃ adinnaṃ ādiyamānaṃ nappahoti hantuṃ vā bandhituṃ vā jāpetuṃ vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā kātuṃ.
an3.100:15.1.eng: What sort of person can’t they punish?

an3.100:15.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco aḍḍho hoti mahaddhano mahābhogo rājā vā rājamahāmatto vā.
an3.100:15.2.eng: A ruler or their chief minister who is rich, affluent, and wealthy.

an3.100:15.3.pli: Evarūpaṃ, bhikkhave, orabbhiko vā urabbhaghātako vā urabbhaṃ adinnaṃ ādiyamānaṃ nappahoti hantuṃ vā bandhituṃ vā jāpetuṃ vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā kātuṃ.
an3.100:15.3.eng: That’s the kind of person they can’t punish.

an3.100:15.4.eng: In fact, all they can do is raise their joined palms and ask:

an3.100:15.5.pli: ‘dehi me, mārisa, urabbhaṃ vā urabbhadhanaṃ vā’ti.
an3.100:15.5.eng: ‘Please, good fellow, give me my sheep or pay me for it.’

an3.100:15.6.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, idhekaccassa puggalassa tādisaṃyeva appamattakampi pāpakammaṃ kataṃ tamenaṃ nirayaṃ upaneti.
an3.100:15.6.eng: This is how it is in the case of an individual who does a trivial bad deed, but it lands them in hell.

an3.100:15.7.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa tādisaṃyeva appamattakaṃ pāpakammaṃ kataṃ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṃ hoti, nāṇupi khāyati, kiṃ bahudeva.
an3.100:15.7.eng: Meanwhile, another individual does the same trivial bad deed, but experiences it in this life, so that not even a little remains, let alone a lot. …

an3.100:16.1.pli: Kathaṃrūpassa, bhikkhave, puggalassa appamattakampi pāpakammaṃ kataṃ tamenaṃ nirayaṃ upaneti?

an3.100:16.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo abhāvitakāyo hoti abhāvitasīlo abhāvitacitto abhāvitapañño paritto appātumo appadukkhavihārī.

an3.100:16.3.pli: Evarūpassa, bhikkhave, puggalassa appamattakampi pāpakammaṃ kataṃ tamenaṃ nirayaṃ upaneti.

an3.100:17.1.pli: Kathaṃrūpassa, bhikkhave, puggalassa tādisaṃyeva appamattakaṃ pāpakammaṃ kataṃ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṃ hoti, nāṇupi khāyati, kiṃ bahudeva?

an3.100:17.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo bhāvitakāyo hoti bhāvitasīlo bhāvitacitto bhāvitapañño aparitto mahatto appamāṇavihārī.

an3.100:17.3.pli: Evarūpassa, bhikkhave, puggalassa tādisaṃyeva appamattakaṃ pāpakammaṃ kataṃ diṭṭhadhammavedanīyaṃ hoti, nāṇupi khāyati, kiṃ bahudeva.

an3.100:18.2.pli: ‘yathā yathāyaṃ puriso kammaṃ karoti tathā tathā taṃ paṭisaṃvedetī’ti, evaṃ santaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyavāso na hoti, okāso na paññāyati sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāya.
an3.100:18.2.eng: ‘No matter how this person performs a deed, they experience it the same way.’ This being so, the spiritual life could not be lived, and there’d be no chance of making a complete end of suffering.

an3.100:18.3.pli: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, evaṃ vadeyya:

an3.100:18.4.pli: ‘yathā yathā vedanīyaṃ ayaṃ puriso kammaṃ karoti tathā tathā tassa vipākaṃ paṭisaṃvedetī’ti, evaṃ santaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyavāso hoti, okāso paññāyati sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāyā”ti.
an3.100:18.4.eng: ‘No matter how this person performs a deed, they experience the result as it should be experienced.’ This being so, the spiritual life can be lived, and there is a chance of making a complete end of suffering.”

an3.101:1.1.pli: “Santi, bhikkhave, jātarūpassa oḷārikā upakkilesā paṃsuvālukā sakkharakaṭhalā.
an3.101:1.1.eng: “Native gold has coarse corruptions: sand, soil, and gravel.

an3.101:1.2.pli: Tamenaṃ paṃsudhovako vā paṃsudhovakantevāsī vā doṇiyaṃ ākiritvā dhovati sandhovati niddhovati.
an3.101:1.2.eng: A panner or their apprentice pours it into a pan, where they wash, rinse, and clean it.

an3.101:1.3.pli: Tasmiṃ pahīne tasmiṃ byantīkate santi jātarūpassa majjhimasahagatā upakkilesā sukhumasakkharā thūlavālukā.
an3.101:1.3.eng: When that’s been eliminated, there are medium corruptions in the native gold: fine grit and coarse sand.

an3.101:1.4.pli: Tamenaṃ paṃsudhovako vā paṃsudhovakantevāsī vā dhovati sandhovati niddhovati.

an3.101:1.5.pli: Tasmiṃ pahīne tasmiṃ byantīkate santi jātarūpassa sukhumasahagatā upakkilesā sukhumavālukā kāḷajallikā.
an3.101:1.5.eng: When that’s been eliminated, there are fine corruptions in the native gold: fine sand and black grime.

an3.101:1.6.pli: Tamenaṃ paṃsudhovako vā paṃsudhovakantevāsī vā dhovati sandhovati niddhovati.

an3.101:1.7.pli: Tasmiṃ pahīne tasmiṃ byantīkate athāparaṃ suvaṇṇasikatāvasissanti.
an3.101:1.7.eng: When that’s been eliminated, only golden flecks remain.

an3.101:1.8.pli: Tamenaṃ suvaṇṇakāro vā suvaṇṇakārantevāsī vā jātarūpaṃ mūsāyaṃ pakkhipitvā dhamati sandhamati niddhamati.
an3.101:1.8.eng: A goldsmith or their apprentice places the native gold in a crucible where they blow, melt, and smelt it.

an3.101:1.9.pli: Taṃ hoti jātarūpaṃ dhantaṃ sandhantaṃ niddhantaṃ aniddhantakasāvaṃ, na ceva mudu hoti na ca kammaniyaṃ, na ca pabhassaraṃ pabhaṅgu ca, na ca sammā upeti kammāya.
an3.101:1.9.eng: Still the native gold is not settled and the dross is not totally gone. It’s not pliable, workable, or radiant, but is brittle and not completely ready for working.

an3.101:1.10.pli: Hoti so, bhikkhave, samayo yaṃ suvaṇṇakāro vā suvaṇṇakārantevāsī vā taṃ jātarūpaṃ dhamati sandhamati niddhamati.
an3.101:1.10.eng: But the goldsmith keeps on blowing, melting, and smelting it.

an3.101:1.11.pli: Taṃ hoti jātarūpaṃ dhantaṃ sandhantaṃ niddhantaṃ niddhantakasāvaṃ, mudu ca hoti kammaniyañca pabhassarañca, na ca pabhaṅgu, sammā upeti kammāya.
an3.101:1.11.eng: The native gold becomes pliable, workable, and radiant, not brittle, and ready to be worked.

an3.101:1.12.pli: Yassā yassā ca pilandhanavikatiyā ākaṅkhati—yadi paṭṭikāya, yadi kuṇḍalāya, yadi gīveyyake, yadi suvaṇṇamālāya—tañcassa atthaṃ anubhoti.
an3.101:1.12.eng: Then the goldsmith can successfully create any kind of ornament they want, whether a bracelet, earrings, a necklace, or a golden garland.

an3.101:2.1.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, santi adhicittamanuyuttassa bhikkhuno oḷārikā upakkilesā kāyaduccaritaṃ vacīduccaritaṃ manoduccaritaṃ, tamenaṃ sacetaso bhikkhu dabbajātiko pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti.
an3.101:2.1.eng: In the same way, a mendicant who is committed to the higher mind has coarse corruptions: bad bodily, verbal, and mental conduct. A sincere, capable mendicant gives these up, gets rid of, eliminates, and obliterates them.

an3.101:2.2.pli: Tasmiṃ pahīne tasmiṃ byantīkate santi adhicittamanuyuttassa bhikkhuno majjhimasahagatā upakkilesā kāmavitakko byāpādavitakko vihiṃsāvitakko, tamenaṃ sacetaso bhikkhu dabbajātiko pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti.
an3.101:2.2.eng: When they’ve been given up and eliminated, there are middling corruptions: sensual, malicious, or cruel thoughts. A sincere, capable mendicant gives these up, gets rid of, eliminates, and obliterates them.

an3.101:2.3.pli: Tasmiṃ pahīne tasmiṃ byantīkate santi adhicittamanuyuttassa bhikkhuno sukhumasahagatā upakkilesā ñātivitakko janapadavitakko anavaññattipaṭisaṃyutto vitakko, tamenaṃ sacetaso bhikkhu dabbajātiko pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti.
an3.101:2.3.eng: When they’ve been given up and eliminated, there are fine corruptions: thoughts of family, country, and status. A sincere, capable mendicant gives these up, gets rid of, eliminates, and obliterates them.

an3.101:2.4.pli: Tasmiṃ pahīne tasmiṃ byantīkate athāparaṃ dhammavitakkāvasissanti.
an3.101:2.4.eng: When they’ve been given up and eliminated, only thoughts about the teaching are left.

an3.101:2.5.pli: So hoti samādhi na ceva santo na ca paṇīto nappaṭippassaddhaladdho na ekodibhāvādhigato sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagato.
an3.101:2.5.eng: That immersion is not peaceful or sublime or tranquil or unified, but is held in place by forceful suppression.

an3.101:2.6.pli: Hoti so, bhikkhave, samayo yaṃ taṃ cittaṃ ajjhattaṃyeva santiṭṭhati sannisīdati ekodi hoti samādhiyati.
an3.101:2.6.eng: But there comes a time when that mind is stilled internally; it settles, unifies, and becomes immersed in samādhi.

an3.101:2.7.pli: So hoti samādhi santo paṇīto paṭippassaddhiladdho ekodibhāvādhigato na sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagato.
an3.101:2.7.eng: That immersion is peaceful and sublime and tranquil and unified, not held in place by forceful suppression.

an3.101:2.8.pli: Yassa yassa ca abhiññā sacchikaraṇīyassa dhammassa cittaṃ abhininnāmeti abhiññā sacchikiriyāya tatra tatreva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati satiāyatane.
an3.101:2.8.eng: They extend the mind to realize by insight each and every thing that can be realized by insight; and they are capable of realizing those things, since each and every one is within range.

an3.101:3.1.pli: So sace ākaṅkhati: ‘anekavihitaṃ iddhividhaṃ paccanubhaveyyaṃ—ekopi hutvā bahudhā assaṃ, bahudhāpi hutvā eko assaṃ; āvibhāvaṃ, tirobhāvaṃ; tirokuṭṭaṃ tiropākāraṃ tiropabbataṃ asajjamāno gaccheyyaṃ, seyyathāpi ākāse; pathaviyāpi ummujjanimujjaṃ kareyyaṃ, seyyathāpi udake; udakepi abhijjamāne gaccheyyaṃ, seyyathāpi pathaviyaṃ; ākāsepi pallaṅkena kameyyaṃ, seyyathāpi pakkhī sakuṇo; imepi candimasūriye evaṃmahiddhike evaṃmahānubhāve pāṇinā parimaseyyaṃ parimajjeyyaṃ; yāva brahmalokāpi kāyena vasaṃ vatteyyan’ti,
an3.101:3.1.eng: If they wish: ‘May I wield the many kinds of psychic power: multiplying myself and becoming one again; materializing and dematerializing; going unobstructed through a wall, a rampart, or a mountain as if through space; diving in and out of the earth as if it were water; walking on water as if it were earth; flying cross-legged through the sky like a bird; touching and stroking with my hand the sun and moon, so mighty and powerful; controlling my body as far as the realm of divinity.’

an3.101:3.2.pli: tatra tatreva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati satiāyatane.
an3.101:3.2.eng: They are capable of realizing these things, since each and every one is within range.

an3.101:4.1.pli: So sace ākaṅkhati: ‘dibbāya sotadhātuyā visuddhāya atikkantamānusikāya ubho sadde suṇeyyaṃ dibbe ca mānuse ca ye dūre santike cā’ti,
an3.101:4.1.eng: If they wish: ‘With clairaudience that is purified and superhuman, may I hear both kinds of sounds, human and heavenly, whether near or far.’

an3.101:4.2.pli: tatra tatreva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati satiāyatane.
an3.101:4.2.eng: They are capable of realizing these things, since each and every one is within range.

an3.101:5.1.pli: So sace ākaṅkhati: ‘parasattānaṃ parapuggalānaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajāneyyaṃ—
an3.101:5.1.eng: If they wish: ‘May I understand the minds of other beings and individuals, having encompassed them with my mind.

an3.101:5.2.pli: sarāgaṃ vā cittaṃ sarāgaṃ cittanti pajāneyyaṃ,
an3.101:5.2.eng: May I understand mind with greed as “mind with greed”,

an3.101:5.3.pli: vītarāgaṃ vā cittaṃ vītarāgaṃ cittanti pajāneyyaṃ;
an3.101:5.3.eng: and mind without greed as “mind without greed”;

an3.101:5.4.pli: sadosaṃ vā cittaṃ sadosaṃ cittanti pajāneyyaṃ,
an3.101:5.4.eng: mind with hate as “mind with hate”,

an3.101:5.5.pli: vītadosaṃ vā cittaṃ vītadosaṃ cittanti pajāneyyaṃ;
an3.101:5.5.eng: and mind without hate as “mind without hate”;

an3.101:5.6.pli: samohaṃ vā cittaṃ samohaṃ cittanti pajāneyyaṃ,
an3.101:5.6.eng: mind with delusion as “mind with delusion”,

an3.101:5.7.pli: vītamohaṃ vā cittaṃ vītamohaṃ cittanti pajāneyyaṃ;
an3.101:5.7.eng: and mind without delusion as “mind without delusion”;

an3.101:5.8.pli: saṅkhittaṃ vā cittaṃ saṅkhittaṃ cittanti pajāneyyaṃ,

an3.101:5.9.pli: vikkhittaṃ vā cittaṃ vikkhittaṃ cittanti pajāneyyaṃ;

an3.101:5.10.pli: mahaggataṃ vā cittaṃ mahaggataṃ cittanti pajāneyyaṃ,

an3.101:5.11.pli: amahaggataṃ vā cittaṃ amahaggataṃ cittanti pajāneyyaṃ;

an3.101:5.12.pli: sauttaraṃ vā cittaṃ sauttaraṃ cittanti pajāneyyaṃ,
an3.101:5.12.eng: mind that is not supreme as “mind that is not supreme”,

an3.101:5.13.pli: anuttaraṃ vā cittaṃ anuttaraṃ cittanti pajāneyyaṃ;
an3.101:5.13.eng: and mind that is supreme as “mind that is supreme”;

an3.101:5.14.pli: samāhitaṃ vā cittaṃ samāhitaṃ cittanti pajāneyyaṃ,
an3.101:5.14.eng: mind immersed in samādhi as “mind immersed in samādhi”,

an3.101:5.15.pli: asamāhitaṃ vā cittaṃ asamāhitaṃ cittanti pajāneyyaṃ;
an3.101:5.15.eng: and mind not immersed in samādhi as “mind not immersed in samādhi”;

an3.101:5.16.pli: vimuttaṃ vā cittaṃ vimuttaṃ cittanti pajāneyyaṃ,

an3.101:5.17.pli: avimuttaṃ vā cittaṃ avimuttaṃ cittanti pajāneyyan’ti,

an3.101:5.18.pli: tatra tatreva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati satiāyatane.
an3.101:5.18.eng: They are capable of realizing these things, since each and every one is within range.

an3.101:6.1.pli: So sace ākaṅkhati: ‘anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussareyyaṃ, seyyathidaṃ—ekampi jātiṃ dvepi jātiyo tissopi jātiyo catassopi jātiyo pañcapi jātiyo dasapi jātiyo vīsampi jātiyo tiṃsampi jātiyo cattālīsampi jātiyo paññāsampi jātiyo jātisatampi jātisahassampi jātisatasahassampi anekepi saṃvaṭṭakappe anekepi vivaṭṭakappe anekepi saṃvaṭṭavivaṭṭakappe: “amutrāsiṃ evaṃnāmo evaṅgotto evaṃvaṇṇo evamāhāro evaṃsukhadukkhappaṭisaṃvedī evamāyupariyanto, so tato cuto amutra udapādiṃ; tatrāpāsiṃ evaṃnāmo evaṅgotto evaṃvaṇṇo evamāhāro evaṃsukhadukkhappaṭisaṃvedī evamāyupariyanto, so tato cuto idhūpapanno”ti, iti sākāraṃ sauddesaṃ anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussareyyan’ti,
an3.101:6.1.eng: If they wish: ‘May I recollect many kinds of past lives. That is: one, two, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, a hundred, a thousand, a hundred thousand rebirths; many eons of the world contracting, many eons of the world expanding, many eons of the world contracting and expanding. May I remember: “There, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn somewhere else. There, too, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn here.” May I recollect my many past lives, with features and details.’

an3.101:6.2.pli: tatra tatreva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati satiāyatane.
an3.101:6.2.eng: They are capable of realizing these things, since each and every one is within range.

an3.101:7.1.pli: So sace ākaṅkhati: ‘dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passeyyaṃ cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe, sugate duggate yathākammūpage satte pajāneyyaṃ: “ime vata bhonto sattā kāyaduccaritena samannāgatā vacīduccaritena samannāgatā manoduccaritena samannāgatā ariyānaṃ upavādakā micchādiṭṭhikā micchādiṭṭhikammasamādānā, te kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapannā; ime vā pana bhonto sattā kāyasucaritena samannāgatā vacīsucaritena samannāgatā manosucaritena samannāgatā ariyānaṃ anupavādakā sammādiṭṭhikā sammādiṭṭhikammasamādānā, te kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapannā”ti, iti dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passeyyaṃ cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe, sugate duggate yathākammūpage satte pajāneyyan’ti,
an3.101:7.1.eng: If they wish: ‘With clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, may I see sentient beings passing away and being reborn—inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in a good place or a bad place—and understand how sentient beings pass on according to their deeds: “These dear beings did bad things by way of body, speech, and mind. They denounced the noble ones; they had wrong view; and they chose to act out of that wrong view. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell. These dear beings, however, did good things by way of body, speech, and mind. They never denounced the noble ones; they had right view; and they chose to act out of that right view. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.” And so, with clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, may I see sentient beings passing away and being reborn—inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in a good place or a bad place. And may I understand how sentient beings pass on according to their deeds.’

an3.101:7.2.pli: tatra tatreva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati satiāyatane.
an3.101:7.2.eng: They are capable of realizing these things, since each and every one is within range.

an3.101:8.1.pli: So sace ākaṅkhati: ‘āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihareyyan’ti,
an3.101:8.1.eng: If they wish: ‘May I realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with my own insight due to the ending of defilements.’

an3.101:8.2.pli: tatra tatreva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati satiāyatane”ti.
an3.101:8.2.eng: They are capable of realizing these things, since each and every one is within range.”
